attributes.action: Prevent false cures for autism being sold to people in the UK
attributes.background: I am concerned about the number of parents being tricked into giving their children bleach solutions, often marketed as MMS (Miracle Mineral solutions), as an autism cure. It can lead to severe injuries or death. I urge the government to prevent the sale of false cures.
attributes.additional_details: Autism cannot be cured and this practice is seeing serious injuries to children, and may result in deaths. Turps and bleach have their place as cleaners, but as doctors have stated "Chlorine dioxide causes abdominal cramps, vomiting and diarrhoea. If you drink it on a long-term basis it causes inflammation of your gut-lining, stomach, oesophagus and intestines and eventually death" https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/brit-kids-forced-drink-bleach-11924623

attributes.action: Mandatory professional assessments for mental health decisions in organisations
attributes.background: Studying and working in the the field of mental health, I have seen both loved ones and service users lose out on employment opportunities and even be removed from positions due to misunderstanding and lay person judgement of their condition. This should not happen, and doesn't for other disability.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst it is currently possible to argue a duty of care motive for treating those with a diagnosed mental health condition differently; whether this is the case should be reviewed by a mental health professional. Otherwise, limitations placed on an individual can constitute disability discrimination. This is not currently mandatory, with occupational health doing this job if anyone. This is more true in voluntary organisations where loss of role is not termination of employment.

attributes.action: Make the UK Government Condem Turkey's actions against the YPG
attributes.background: The Turkish government has insisted for many years that the YPG, a group based mainly of the Kurdish people, a race historically oppressed by the Turkish government, is a terrorist organisation, going as far to blame them for domestic terrorist events in Turkey without any prior evidence or backing.
attributes.additional_details:
The YPG is already a struggling fighting force, backed by several NATO countries in the fight against the international terrorist organisation Daesh. Unlike the YPG whose policies preach equality, peace and democracy, Daesh present an international danger to any country that supports western ideals of freedom and rights for all. The military might of turkey greatly outweighs that of the YPG, which already faces a difficult and long battle against Daesh, one which is greatly hindered by the targeted smart bombs dropped by Turkish jets, constant artillery barrages and mechanized troops on the Turkish border.
massacres and repression:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights_of_Kurdish_people_in_Turkey
Operation 'Olive Branch'
http://www.rudaw.net/english/middleeast/syria/200120181

attributes.action: Stop once and for all unsolicited SMS fraud in the UK
attributes.background: Shady companies are sending fraudulent unsolicited premium rate SMS text messages to mobile phone owners in the UK. These cost recipients up to £4.50 a message often resulting in huge bills to the victim as the fraud is likely to go unnoticed for long periods of time.
attributes.additional_details:
Find a detailed description of the issue here:

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3580058/Thousands-hit-4-50-time-scam-Customers-facing-bills-hundreds-pounds-texts-advertising-gaming-services-pornographic-content.html

This petition posits it should be a legal requirement for phone carriers to:

Not allow these services be activated on a customer’s account unless they have explicitly requested so (e.g. a representative of the carrier calls the customer to confirm activation of this service was indeed requested). If a carrier does not have this framework in place, they should not be allowed to operate premium SMS services at all.

attributes.action: Giving the British people the right to remove members of the Lords by petition.
attributes.background: I want to start this petition because some of the unelected members of the Lords are ignoring the will of the British people and acting in their own interests. There is no participation by the British people in who is appointed to the Lords. In a real democracy there should be a way to remove them .
attributes.additional_details: I help run a large Community Hall and a significant number of the membership when asked about the interference of the Lords into the EU referendum cannot understand why they are not answerable to anyone.

attributes.action: Use all National Lottery profits to help fund National Health Service
attributes.background: It is clear that our NHS is overstretched and desperately requires additional funding. There is, in my opinion, no more worthy a cause for National Lottery money to be spent on. It is my belief that tens of thousands additional tickets would be purchased for this cause.
attributes.additional_details: Having put this idea to many people over recent months the general consensus is that most people, like me, would be happy to invest £10 per week if we knew the money was going to the NHS.

attributes.action: Scrap the drivers CPC
attributes.background: Now we are leaving the European Union we should scrap the drivers CPC as it stops people getting back into driving jobs unless they complete this pointless course that can be about anything from healthy eating to general health and safety also a waste of my time and money.

attributes.action: Ban the Commercial speed restrictions on vehicles such as duel use pickups,
attributes.background: Vehicles such as Dual Cab pickups are still subjected to commercial speed restrictions on certain roads due to their curb weight even thou they are someone’s personal vehicle and not used for commercial use, remove these restrictions for personal use vehicles,
attributes.additional_details: If your pickup exceeds a unladen weight of 2048 kilos it has speed restrictions on certain roads which is rubbish as most modern cars such as range rovers weight sometimes over 3 tonne, just because a vehicle is deemed commercial doesn’t mean it should be restricted, personal use commercial vehicles not being used for business shouldn’t be subjected to this law, as new pick ups have better safety equipment than when this law was written,

attributes.action: Allow Petitions Calling for No Confidence in Ministers on petition.parliament.uk
attributes.background: Call government/parliament to allow petitions calling for a vote of No Confidence in Ministers/MPs due to the recent decision by the petitions committee not to accept/allow them. The decision should be made by the British public who politicians, parliament & the petitions committee are answerable to
attributes.additional_details: We live in a democratic country where the general public must have a voice that can be heard and taken into account.  Ministers and MPs must be accountable to the general public who should have the right to submit a petition for debate which people across the U.K. can support.  Some previous petitions calling for No Confidence have had over 100,000 signatures however only a few people in the petitions committee have decided not to allow them in the future

attributes.action: Take pitbulls out of the Dangerous Dogs Act
attributes.background: Pitbulls are not dangerous dogs. They are called nanny dogs, they look after their family.  They get blamed for all sorts of bad press. If people treated them with respect like any other dog they would know how loving they are.
attributes.additional_details:
Pitbulls look after their families and they are very loving like any other dog you can see.

They have been more bites off small dogs than a large one

attributes.action: Highlights of all Test Matches (cricket) involving the Home Nations free to air
attributes.background: Currently only England home test match highlights have to be free to air, which means that the achievements of our cricketers whilst abroad cannot to seen by the majority of fans.
attributes.additional_details:
The actual changed needed it to add all Test Matches (cricket) involving the Home Nations to Category B in the Ofcom Code on Sports and Other Listed and Designated Events.

Sport England’s latest active people survey shows that over the past decade (since, coincidence or not, cricket was last on free-to-air TV) the number of people aged over 16 who play it at least once a week has dropped from 195,200 to 158,500 and the number who play at least once a month has dropped from 380,300 to 278,600.

attributes.action: Request that any Brexit bill be itemised and debated in parliament and public.
attributes.background:
Since the vote to leave the EU there have been multiple figures given in the press over any divorce bill varying between 20 - 100 billion pounds. 
We the undersigned demand that prior to any exit agreement the divorce bill should be itemised and made available for parliamentary and public scrutiny.
attributes.additional_details: Daily updates in the national and world press regarding the so called Brexit " divorce bill".

attributes.action: Provide free broadband to every UK home
attributes.background: Broadband is a necessity in today's world and should therefore be accessible to all, much like fresh running water and electricity. Surely if every house was provided with broadband through a nationalised BT Openreach, it would be more cost effective than each person arranging their own.
attributes.additional_details: The infrastructure already exists to provide every home in the UK with free broadband and would not be an expensive project. BT Openreach have an undeserved monopoly in this market and should be nationalised to provide this public service. The minimal cost could be added to our council tax bills and would be a lot less than most homes currently pay for broadband. Like most public services those less able to pay, would pay less through means tested lower council tax bills but all would benefit

attributes.action: The undersigned ask for the following to b implemented to End the Housing Crisis
attributes.background: We are in a Housing Crisis and something desperately needs to be done , such as these initiatives below;
attributes.additional_details:
GIVE Bursaries/reduce restrictions on Brownfield sites, especially to smaller housing companies;This will allow for more building, with the added benefit of being more sustainable.

THAT each development Must have a specified % of Council, Affordable, Single-living & Various bedroom houses avaliable, so to meet the needs of all the community. 

A LAW that after a developer has received planning permission, they have a specified amount of time in which to finish their build, to stop Land Banking.

attributes.action: Stop penalising long-term partners at 40% when it comes to Inheritance Tax
attributes.background: We believe, in terms of Inheritance Tax, long-term partners are being treated grossly unfairly as opposed to married couples/civil partners.  Like millions of others in this country, long-term partners are equally committed to each other as anyone else and should not be penalised with a 40% tax!
attributes.additional_details: Some12,000,000 people in this country for many personal reasons choose not to marry.  In some cases a previous bad experience in marriage may persuade them not to say "I do" for a second time. Previous correspondence from the Treasury suggested that married couples/civil partners were seen as being in "committed/recognised" relationships.  This is something of an insult to genuine couples who have been together but unmarried for 25+ years. The government must stop this totally unfair prejudice.

attributes.action: Change the way fines i.e. Speeding/Drunk and Disorderly are calculated.
attributes.background: Instead of a fixed price fine we should have a proportional fine so it affects each person the same way, it should be 10% of the offending persons average weekly wage (10% of 1/52th, 1 weeks worth, of last year's net pay) or a minimum of £80, whichever is the greater.
attributes.additional_details:
This way it have much more of an equal affect upon the culprit and even out some balance of a unfair prosecution system which effects the poorest more.

For example in October this year (2017) a professional footballer was caught speeding and was fined £440, alot of money for a person on minimum wage but does not have the same impact on someone reportedly earning £37,500 per week. This may be an extreme example however I feel this change allow punishment to be felt equally across the board.

attributes.action: Eliminate Tax Avoidance - Introduce 2% Minimum Corporation Tax based on Turnover
attributes.background: As an example, eBay’s total UK revenue last year was c£1bn and £1.6m in corporation tax was paid. This petition would see eBay pay a minimum £20m (12.5 times more).  All companies regardless of size would be forced to pay their fair share of tax including Apple, Amazon, Google and Starbucks.
attributes.additional_details:
It is reasonable to expect that all companies who wish to participate in the UK economy should be treated equally and the minimum corporation tax rate on turnover should be the price they pay.

The minimum corporation tax could be collected in advance at the point of sales and/or assessed annually based on reported turnover.

Incidentally, FTSE 100 companies, on average, have seen their corporation tax expense to turnover go from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years.

attributes.action: Increase the funding for additional support for prison officers well-being.
attributes.background:
Prison officers are in a highly demanding and challenging job that requires readily available support systems in terms of both their mental health and well-being. 
We are petitioning for:
More counselling with independent professional counsellors to deal with mental health in the work place.
attributes.additional_details:
7159 assaults on prison officers and serious assaults on prison officers has trebled from previous year (MOJ, 2017); impacting their psychological and physical safety at work, overall effecting the prison system in whole.
We think this intervention would be beneficial for prison officers, prisoners and society as a whole.

attributes.action: Ban nut products by supermarket checkouts promoted for impulsive purchasing.
attributes.background: For those with severe nut allergies such as myself, avoiding the nut aisle in a supermarket is usually easy, however having to dodge them at the checkout where supermarkets promote impulsive buying, makes shopping in general increasingly difficult and potentially dangerous.
attributes.additional_details: I've noticed more and more that supermarkets are stocking shelves at the checkout with nut products to encourage shoppers to purchase them impulsively. Although impulse buying is not something that concerns me, having to weave through the already narrow area to pay for your shopping to avoid having an allergy attack seems totally unnecessary, which is why I think that nut products should only be sold on an aisle in the shop, and not used as a product to promote impulsive buying at the checkout.

attributes.action: Reduce VAT rate on fixed telephone lines and broadband
attributes.background:
Telephone lines with broadband are an essential utility for the 21st century.

Currently there is a 20% VAT levied on all services, other essential utilities are not subject to such a high rate of taxation.
attributes.additional_details:
The government is well aware of the benefits of a connected society and documents them extensively: https://www.gov.uk/government/policies/broadband-investment

Individuals and businesses benefit massively from internet and telephone connectivity and this in turn benefits our economy.

Other utilities which are essential, such as water, electricity and gas are subject to reduced rates of taxation. Telephone and broadband services should be treated the same, as an essential utility.

attributes.action: Make teaching about tax and local politics compulsory in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Many people when they leave secondary school and college are thrown into the deep end of life and know nothing about the world they are entering into causing them to end up in debt or not even know how to pay bills.

attributes.action: Create a new public holiday for Indian new year's day
attributes.background: Show the British people that Government policies are truly representative of the the cultural diversity across our society. Diwali and Indian New Year mark an important time of the year for many different groups and we should mark this occasion with a public holiday.

attributes.action: Make spent conviction dismissals a protected right for -2 years in employment
attributes.background: Having recently been dismissed for having a spent conviction despite the protection under the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1979. Under employment law this action is unlawful and would lead to an automatic unfair dismissal if an individual has 2 years service. This action is discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Sec 4 of the rehabilitation of offenders act 1979 makes it unlawful to be sacked simply for not disclosing a spent conviction, yet there is no penalty or recourse for the rehabilitated person to take action against this form of discrimination!  
As this is already listed as an automatic unfair dismissal, then it should be looked at to decrease the requirement of 2 years service and treat it the same as the other protected reasons such as whistleblowing, discrimination etc.

attributes.action: Minimum tax rate for tax avoiders -Raise ££bn extra tax for health and education
attributes.background: The introduction of a 15% minimum income tax rate for an individual or company would raise tens of billions in additional tax receipts each year to help fund health, education and social care without the need to raise existing tax rates, cut funding elsewhere or to borrow more money.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, tax avoiders can legally reduce the tax liability on their income to next to nothing without any restriction.
Any individual or company who resides or operates within the UK and uses a known avoidance scheme or has connected parties or subsidiaries registered in a tax jurisdiction where the effective tax rate is less than 15% should pay the new minimum tax rate.  This will apply to UK income and all income recorded in these jurisdictions whether or not it is remitted back to UK.

attributes.action: The UK government should impose economic sanctions on Spain over Catalonia.
attributes.background: On 1st October 2017 the people of Catalonia voted for independence despite attempts by the central Spanish government to prevent the referendum. Scenes were shown across the media of the brutality shown towards Catalonia citizens, but the UK's response since has been shameful.
attributes.additional_details: A fundamental British value (or so we teach our children) is the importance of democracy. A right to vote and determine the future of your own people is a right protected under the European Convention on Human Rights and a pre-requisite of EU membership, not to mention the hallmark of a fair and free society. The UK government's response should recognise this by imposing sanctions against Spain or taking other diplomatic steps to secure the rights of the Catalonian people.

attributes.action: Calculate student maintenance loans in a fairer way
attributes.background: Student maintenance loans are calculated on a household income basis. This method is not Fair as parents are expected to make up the rest but can’t with a bigger family. The aim of this is to have the loans be calculated by disposable income per person in the household rather than the overall income
attributes.additional_details: Maintenance loans are currently calculated by household income rather than disposable income per person, meaning that some students may get the same maintenance loan despite their parents being able to assist them more financially, as parents are expected to make up what we don’t get of the loan. This means an only child will have more support than someone with 3 younger siblings because their parents earn the same amount which isn’t fair as one family is more able to provide support

attributes.action: Government to place a Bill before Parliament to legalise Pre-nuptial agreements
attributes.background: The Government has failed consistently to legislate to legalise Pre-nuptial agreements and to set civil and criminal penalties for commercially and ‘culturally’ forced marriage. These issues need to be addressed urgently to strengthen the rights of all marriage contracts post-2013.
attributes.additional_details:
We call upon the Government to place a forced marriages and marriage contract Bill before Parliament which would repeal the current Forced Marriage (Civil Protection) Act 2007.

The Bill would allow the prevention of the equitable aspects of marriage being used as an instrument of fraud - strengthening the true intentions of the contracting parties. It would also impose set criminal and civil sanctions for the act of ‘forcing’ a marriage contract.

attributes.action: The UK must expel the North Korean ambassador
attributes.background:
North Korea is a rogue state threatening the entire world.  They are extreme cybercriminals, exporters of terrorism, and have now ramped up their nuclear weapons programme in defiance of UN sanctions and international outcry.

We must send a strong message by expelling their ambassador.
attributes.additional_details:
Other countries which have expelled their North Korean ambassador include: Spain; Kuwait; Peru; Mexico; and Botswana.  Meanwhile Egypt, the Philippines, and Uganda have drastically scaled back diplomatic ties.

London has an (est. 20,000) Korean community from both North and South.  North Korean "enforcers" spy on this community as well as locals (who aren't always Korean) near the embassy, intimidating people who joke about the country or regime.

They shouldn't benefit from life in London.

attributes.action: NHS access should not be part of any trade negotiations with any foreign power.
attributes.background: The NHS, since its coming into being in 1948 has been a, perhaps THE,  social cement even in times of national division. It is an institution that is for the people and of the people and should be protected as our prime national asset.
attributes.additional_details: Poll upon poll has shown the depth of feeling the British people have for the NHS.  Most recently. 60,000 marched in defence of the Service.

attributes.action: Raise income tax by 0.25%, ring-fenced for NHS and post-discharge social care.
attributes.background:
The NHS is at crisis point with A&E having patients in all corners and in a queue of ambulances outside It needs extra money to provide for good quality services and the type of social care that would help to stop bed blocking in hospitals.

Waiting lists for clinics  and tests are too long.
attributes.additional_details:
Most people I know would be prepared to pay more income tax as long as it is used as extra money for the NHS and social care to enable discharge from hospital when nursing is no longer needed.

Doctor and nurse staff morale is low because of the pressures in trying to care for sick people without the resources to do so.

Bed occupancy is at 94% in England which is not entirely due to influenza as elective surgery was cancelled to cover this. The NHS could not cope with a further crisis.

attributes.action: Hold Referendum in Scotland, to end devolution and return control to Westminster
attributes.background: Due to the actions of the Scottish government, ruining Scotland's economy and creating severe division in the populace, there is an increasing opinion that the welfare of the Scottish people could be better served by the Westminster Government.

attributes.action: Stop Reducing our Armed Forces and Spend 3% of GDP. CUT AID to 0.3% to fund it.
attributes.background: When I say "reduce" I mean in three ways: Funding, manpower & resources and credibility. We're told the Government spends 2% of GDP on defence and we have "the second largest budget in NATO... Largest in Europe". Then why can't we even match the French in capability anymore? Spend 3% GDP on Defence.
attributes.additional_details: France has 23 Destroyers and Frigates. We've 19. They've 3 Amphibious ships. We've 2 which are now going to be scrapped. Their Army is 30,000 bigger. You now want to cut another 14,000 and are talking about merging two extremely distinct units: Royal Marines and Parachute Regiment. It's a joke. You don't want the Army to "Be the Best" and the new adverts are laughable. Recruits join for war fighting, adventure and service. Not for PC. That 2% clearly feels like 1% and those in charge are inept.

attributes.action: Ban plastic drinking straws in pubs, cafes, cinemas and restaurants.
attributes.background: The use of plastic drinking straws in establishments that sell liquid refreshment, either alcoholic or non alcoholic should be banned. They are unnecessary, a waste of plastic as they are for single use only, harmful to the environment, land and sea creatures.

attributes.action: To be allowed 500 words / 2 sides of notes to every GCSE exam.
attributes.background: As a GCSE student, me and other students feel it would be beneficial to let all students have at least 500 words or 2 sides of notes during a GCSE exam. As the exams should teach students knowledge on how to apply information and use it correctly and efficiently, and not to cram excess information.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free of charge in the UK for people diagnosed with IBD
attributes.background: IBD is one of the only chronic illnesses where sufferers have to pay for prescriptions. More often than not they will need medication for life. It is unfair that they have to pay for it when other chronic illnesses are recognised for the purpose of free of charge prescriptions.

attributes.action: Make the 26-30 railcard pilot available to more than just Greater Anglia users.
attributes.background: As a welcome resource for travelling millennials, the 26-30 railcard was announced in the Chancellor's budget on the 22 November 2017. However, it is currently ONLY being piloted in the Greater Anglia area of the United Kingdom. I urge the government to consider piloting this in more than one area.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, millennials are one of the demographic groups in the UK that are hardest hit in terms of affordability of living. With stagnant wages and rising inflation and for most, a thirst for wanderlust, the 26-30 railcard should've been available as soon as it was announced. Another pressure on millennials is that many commute to their workplaces as majority live with their parents as they are unable to afford a house of their own. I urge the government to pilot this railcard in other areas.

attributes.action: Keep accepting credit card payments for all tax payments
attributes.background: The Government are stopping accepting credit card payments from 13th January 2018 - please sign to keep the acceptance of credit card payments after this date.
attributes.additional_details: Small business owner

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory maximum speed limiters on all vehicles driven on UK roads.
attributes.background: Most production cars & motorcycles manufactured today are capable of speeds well in excess of 70 mph with some high performance models able to reach up to 155mph.
attributes.additional_details: Criminals ignore speed limits and we regularly see news reports of police pursuing stolen high performance cars in excess of 100mph with some causing deaths and injuries. It is illegal to drive above the speed limit. Why are cars that can travel over the maximum legal speed limit allowed on our roads? The new range of Ford Fiestas have maximum speeds of between 99 and 121mph (Autocar). I am calling for compulsory top speed  limiters to be fitted to all vehicles used on UK roads to save lives.

attributes.action: Add directly democratic measures to the political process of the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Pure representative democracy offers only the power to select humans for office, not the right to influence policy. Whilst protest is available to voice policy concerns, it is not a direct solution, and often not heeded. Some access to direct democracy would offer a check to representative action.
attributes.additional_details:
It is reasonably evident, after a century of representative democracy, that the process is flawed. Representatives are often elected on overly optimistic statements, false promises, even lies. Once in power, the judicial branch is often too slow to provide a check or balance for representative actions. 

Putting a Swiss style democratic system in place - where the electorate can, through petition, gain access to referendum, would offer a timely check on laws passed by representatives.

attributes.action: Ban LED vehicle headlights
attributes.background: These new LED headlights are horrendous for drivers with any kind of light sensitivity, and probably not great for anyone. I literally put my hand in front of my eyes when a car with these lights approach. Instinctive reflex to protect my eyes, highly dangerous when driving!  Normal headlights fine.

attributes.action: Make ATM Charges Illegal
attributes.background: ATM charges can make it impossible for poor people to access their own money without falling into debt. If you share my belief, that this is appalling, then sign my petition. Banks cannot be allowed to make further profit from poverty.

attributes.action: Provide PIP for ALL type 1 diabetics who make a claim
attributes.background: Type 1 diabetes falls under the definition of a disability under the Equality Act 2010, which defines a disability as ‘a physical or mental impairment that has a substantial long-term negative effect on a person’s ability to carry out normal day-to-day activities’. PIP should be awarded to all T1D

attributes.action: Require Train Companies to refund and/or exchange advance-purchase train tickets
attributes.background: Trains do not refund or even at least exchange advance purchase tickets. There is no economic value to society or benefit to the customer for this. If people's plans change, or they mistakenly book the wrong date, they should be allowed to refund it within a certain timeframe.
attributes.additional_details: You can't get a refund on an advance purchase ticket months in advance, unless you exchange it for another advance purchase ticket at the cost of £10. This is not fair for consumers. This is simply companies trying to squeeze out every penny they can from the consumer. Megabus charge £1 to change your tickets, but trains charge £10, and if you're train ticket is around £10 - £30 anyway, on balance it's cheaper buying a new one. This would also help trains stop overreserving seats in carriages too.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health Awareness Training Mandatory for All Employers and Managers
attributes.background: Mental health problems have a greater impact on people’s ability to work than any other group of disorders. At the moment, we have no mandatory protocol, training or support for people who suffer with Mental Illness and this usually ends in dismissal by a manager or resignation of an employee.
attributes.additional_details: I, as well as thousands of other people in the UK, find it hard to talk out about Mental Health, especially when our Job is concerned. We can’t come to terms with telling our Manager as we fear for our job. People suffering with Depression, Anxiety or any other Mental Health condition should be supported at work. This Petition is to make Employers and Managers carry out the correct training to educate them on what we go through on a daily basis and ways to avoid our conditions spiralling

attributes.action: Raise the Help to Buy ISA qualifying limit to £300k to match Stamp Duty policy.
attributes.background: It was recently announced that Stamp Duty was abolished for first time buyers on properties up to £300,000. However, Help to Buy ISA’s only qualify for the bonus on properties up to £250,000. I feel this qualifying limit should be raised to £300,000 to be in line with the new Stamp Duty.

attributes.action: Make all cyclists use cycle paths where provided rather than using roads.
attributes.background:
Why as a cyclist would we want to not use an area dedicated to us for our safety, and irritate motor vehicle drivers by not using what has cost thousands of pounds to provide.
If we use these dedicated cycle ways we will reduce the amount of accidents and injuries to fellow cyclists.

attributes.action: Make ice cream van drivers pass a DBS check before attaining a trading license
attributes.background: Some ice cream drivers have been abusing their position by grooming and sexually abusing children. Let’s make our children and communities safe. Click the links in “more details” for some articles, google it and you’ll sadly find more. Make it legislation they must pass a DBS check prior to trading.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/wirral-ice-cream-seller-jailed-5373318.amp

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/wfla.com/2017/10/30/man-who-sells-ice-cream-in-bradenton-arrested-for-sexually-assaulting-6-year-old-girl/amp/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/amp.fox13news.com/news/local-news/ice-cream-man-accused-of-molesting-6-year-old-girl

attributes.action: To require each energy supplier to set a standard Standing Charge across tariffs
attributes.background: Energy suppliers offer multiple tariffs, which are likely to have different combinations of unit price and daily standing charge. Making an informed decision about WHICH tariff and/or supplier to use is made more complex by having these differences. Unit only variables would simplify that choice.
attributes.additional_details: I've just been through the process again, spent hours doing many calculations and making comparisons between, not only one energy supplier's tariffs, but also between multiple suppliers, it was confusing and impossible to make an informed choice. I consulted acquaintances, friends and family, who all agreed. Having just ONE standard daily standing charge would make such choice simpler by removing one variable. Switching may be ideal in principle, but is often a leap in the dark for many people.

attributes.action: Make tax incentives and laws for companies allowing people to work  from home.
attributes.background: Because a lot of people travel into work in cities we are overloading the traffic infrastructure, creating pollution. parking problems and destroying country villages. Give companies incentives to allow them to support home workers, remove laws making companies for being responsible for home areas.
attributes.additional_details: companies are made responsible for the environment that people are working in at home, allow workers to opt out of this protection so they can work at home. Companies should only be responsible for the computers and equipment they supply nothing else. this will allow people with children to work from home. also companies can use more part time workers.

attributes.action: Pass legislation for the use of indelible ink pens mandatory for ALL elections.
attributes.background: In an age where pens are as cost effective as pencils, there is no excuse why the use of indelible ink pens should not be made mandatory. Old arguments on cost and potential for ink to smudge are not relevant today. However, a perception votes cast using a pencil can be manipulated, is a concern.
